TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON: Picnicpoint peat in a tidal marsh on a slope of 0 percent at an elevation of 4 m (The soil was wet throughout the profile when described on July 23, 2007.)
Oi1--0 to 70 cm; peat, pale brown (10YR 6/3) dry, brown (10YR 4/3) moist; many very fine and fine and common medium roots; strongly acid (pH 5.3); diffuse wavy boundary
W--70 to 120 cm; water; diffuse smooth boundary
Oi2--120 to 160 cm; peat, light yellowish brown (10YR 6/4) dry, dark yellowish brown (10YR 4/4) moist; moderately acid (pH 5.7); diffuse smooth boundary
Cg--160 to 180 cm; silt loam, light brownish gray (2.5Y 6/2) dry, dark grayish brown (2.5Y 4/2) moist; massive; slightly hard, firm, nonsticky and nonplastic; moderately acid (pH 5.9)

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION: Dillingham Census Area, Alaska, about 10 km east-southeast of the city of Dillingham; latitude 58.9966667 degrees north, longitude 158.2916667 degrees west, datum WGS 84 (coordinates determined with a GPS)

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:
Mean annual soil temperature--1 to 2 degrees C
Soil moisture control section--saturated all days during the growing season (peraquic moisture regime)
Thickness of fibric soil material--100 to 170 cm
Oi horizons
Hue--10YR, 2.5Y
Value--2 to 4 moist, 4 to 6 dry
Chroma--2 to 4 moist
Reaction--5.1 to 6.1
Organic matter content--60 to 100 percent
Rubbed fiber content--40 to 80 percent
Sodium pyrophosphate color value and chroma where rubbed fiber content is 40 to 75 percent--7/1, 7/2, 8/1, 8/2, 8/3
Thickness--100 to 170 cm
W horizon
Thickness--5 to 70 cm
Cg horizon (where present)
Hue--10Y, 2.5Y, 5Y
Value--4 or 5 moist, 6 or 7 dry
Chroma--1 or 2 moist
Fine-earth texture--silt, silt loam
Clay content--2 to 12 percent
Reaction--5.5 to 6.8
Electrical conductivity--0 to 4 ds/m
Thickness--more than 5 cm

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content:
GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:
Elevation--0 to 10 m
Climate--warm, moist summers; cold, moist winters
Mean annual precipitation--520 to 720 mm
Mean annual air temperature--0.9 to 1.7 degrees C
Frost-free period--85 to 140 days

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content:
GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:
Mudie--no organic soil horizons; tidal flats

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content:
DRAINAGE AND SATURATED HYDRAULIC CONDUCTIVITY:
Drainage class--very poorly drained
Flooding--frequent, brief
Saturation in normal years--at the surface during all months
Saturated hydraulic conductivity (Ksat)--moderately high or high throughout the profile

USE AND VEGETATION.content:
USE AND VEGETATION:
Use--wildlife habitat, recreation, subsistence
Potential natural vegetation--sweetgale, dwarf birch, Alaska bog willow, leatherleaf, bluejoint grass, Lyngbye's sedge, purple marshlocks, sphagnum moss

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT: Bristol Bay Lowlands, Alaska; MLRA 236; small extent

REGIONAL OFFICE.content: SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (SSRO) RESPONSIBLE: Portland, Oregon

ORIGIN.content: SERIES ESTABLISHED: Togiak National Wildlife Refuge-Ahklun Mountains Area, Dillingham Census Area, Alaska; 2019

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:
Diagnostic horizons and other features in this pedon
*Control section--zone from 0 to 130 cm
*Surface tier--zone from 0 to 30 cm
*Subsurface tier--zone from 30 to 90 cm
*Bottom tier--zone from 90 to 130 cm
*Fibric soil material--Oi horizons
*Reduced matrix--Cg horizon
*Aquic conditions--0 to 180 cm
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.
